title: Ticket #1318: Have DAGMan be a server or daemon
description:
Just yimmed with Igor S about this -- he's interested in a scenario along the lines of having DAGMan be a daemon that would run multiple DAGs -- so he can run a lot of DAGs (independently) without having the overhead of a separate DAGMan for each one. (And Miron has proposed this idea in the past, too.) I think the idea is that you'd have a DAGMan daemon, kind of like the schedd, and condor_submit_dag would communicate with that daemon, instead of submitting a Condor job.

There's an awful lot to think about, though: * Just having multiple DAG objects inside DAGMan would take a lot of surgery. * Establishing a protocol for communicating with the daemon. * What happens when you want to condor_rm one DAG? * And I suspect that there are a ton of little gotchas waiting...

Anyhow, I told Igor that I'd make a ticket for this, but I really think it can't get worked on without a push from Miron, because it will be a big job.
